purpleculture_pinyin:
fēng
insane; mad; wild
безумный; Сумасшедший; дикий
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 疯)
Pictophonetic: 風 indicates the sound; 疒 (sickness) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
瘋狂 [ fēng kuáng ]: crazy; frantic; extreme popularity
瘋牛病 [ fēng niú bìng ]: mad cow disease (bovine spongiform encephalopathy)
瘋癲 [ fēng diān ]: insane; crazy

    • 疒 [ nè ] sickness, disease
    • 風 [ fēng ] wind; air; customs, manners; news
heisig_chinese_memo: The windstorm lasts so long that you get cabin fever from staying inside, and become insane, a mental illness.
Ru_trainchinese: fēng: (прил/глаг) сумасшедший, безумный; буйный, необузданный; резвиться, сходить с ума; (о растениях) не плодоносить
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Windstorms in the future bring a mental sickness which causes people to go insane.
humanum_full_description_en:
From "疒" to " wind " sound. The original meaning is head madness. "Ji Yun. "East Rhyme": "Crazy, head sick." "Zhengzitong. "Fun Bu": "Crazy, head madness." Head madness is a headache. "Head madness" was originally written as "head wind", such as "Three Kingdoms. Wei Shu. "Fang Ji Chuan": "The Taizu has a bitter head, and every time he sends it, he is confused and dizzy. It is acupuncture, and it is easy to lose ." Later, "疒" was added. "Fang Shu": "Crazy head is on the right, phlegm, and heat; on the left, wind, and blood deficiency."

The common meaning of " crazy " is insanity and mental disorder. Such as "Liao Zhai Zhi Yi. "Painted Skin": "There are crazy people in the market, sometimes lying in the dung." Kong Shangren in the Qing Dynasty "Peach Blossom Fan. "Detective Opera": "At that time, there was neither a madness of heart failure nor a disease of sweat. How could he make a mistake and become a Wei Dang?" Chapter 1 of "Dream of Red Mansions": "That monk's head is stumped, That lame and disheveled head, crazy, squandering, talking and laughing."

" Crazy " also means paralysis. In the volume of "Yue Yan" by Fan Yin in the Qing Dynasty: "Madman, this is the name of the hand and foot paralyzed." For example, "The Strange Situation I've Witnessed in Twenty Years" Chapter 66: "You know that Shudan Lake later became paralyzed. "Midnight" Mao Dun: "He has half of his limbs crazy, and half of his body can't move."

" Crazy " can also describe crops that grow vigorously but do not bear fruit, such as crazy growth, crazy branches, and crazy branches. For example, Liu Shaotang's "Little Lotus Shows Pointy Horns": "It is not expected that after the wheat is harvested, there will be more rain than in previous years, the melon seedlings will grow wildly, and the raw melon will be fired."
humanum_short_description_en: From "疒", " wind " sound. The original meaning is head madness.
humanum_full_description:
從「疒」，「風」聲。本義是頭瘋病。《集韻．東韻》：「瘋，頭病。」《正字通．疒部》：「瘋，頭瘋病。」頭瘋病即頭痛病，「頭瘋」最初寫作「頭風」，如《三國志．魏書．方伎傳》：「太祖苦頭風，每發，心亂目眩，佗鍼鬲，隨手而差。」後來才加上「疒」。《方書》：「偏頭瘋，在右屬痰，屬熱；在左屬風，屬血虛。」

　　「瘋」的常用義是神經錯亂、精神失常。如《聊齋志異．畫皮》：「市上有瘋者，時臥糞土中。」清代孔尚任《桃花扇．偵戲》：「彼時既無失心之瘋，又非汗邪之病，怎的主意一錯，竟做了一個魏黨？」《紅樓夢》第1回：「那僧癩頭跣足，那道跛足蓬頭，瘋瘋癲癲，揮霍談笑而至。」

　　「瘋」又表示癱瘓。清代范寅《越諺》卷中：「瘋子，此專名手足癱瘓者。」如《二十年目睹之怪現狀》第66回：「你那裡知道，那舒淡湖後來得了個瘋癱的毛病。」茅盾《子夜》：「他那半肢瘋，半個身子簡直不能動。」

　　「瘋」還可以形容農作物生長旺盛，但不結果實，如瘋長、瘋枝、瘋杈。如劉紹棠《小荷才露尖尖角》：「哪料到麥收過後，比往年雨水勤，瓜秧子瘋長，生瓜就放炮。」
humanum_short_description: 從「疒」，「風」聲。本義是頭瘋病。

  • ⿸ Surround from upper left

    • 風 [ fēng ] wind; air; customs, manners; news
①病名，通常指精神病，患者神經錯亂，精神失常：瘋癲。瘋狂。
②言行狂妄：瘋言瘋語。
③農作物生長旺盛而不結果實：小麥長瘋了。

Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 風 indicates the sound; 疒 (sickness) conveys the meaning.
HSK: 5
Chinese: The windstorm lasts so long that you get cabin fever from staying inside, and become insane, a mental illness.
Meaning: insane
Hanzi: 疯
Story: Windstorms in the future bring a mental sickness which causes people to go insane.
Kind: traditional
從「 疒 」，「 風 」聲。本義是頭瘋病。《集韻．東韻》：「瘋，頭病。」《正字通．疒部》：「瘋，頭瘋病。」頭瘋病即頭痛病，「頭瘋」最初寫作「頭風」，如《三國志．魏書．方伎傳》：「太祖苦頭風，每發，心亂目眩，佗鍼鬲，隨手而差。」後來才加上「 疒 」。《方書》：「偏頭瘋，在右屬痰，屬熱；在左屬風，屬血虛。」 「 瘋 」的常用義是神經錯亂、精神失常。如《聊齋志異．畫皮》：「市上有瘋者，時臥糞土中。」清代孔尚任《桃花扇．偵戲》：「彼時既無失心之瘋，又非汗邪之病，怎的主意一錯，竟做了一個魏黨？」《紅樓夢》第1回：「那僧癩頭跣足，那道跛足蓬頭，瘋瘋癲癲，揮霍談笑而至。」 「 瘋 」又表示癱瘓。清代范寅《越諺》卷中：「瘋子，此專名手足癱瘓者。」如《二十年目睹之怪現狀》第66回：「你那裡知道，那舒淡湖後來得了個瘋癱的毛病。」茅盾《子夜》：「他那半肢瘋，半個身子簡直不能動。」 「 瘋 」還可以形容農作物生長旺盛，但不結果實，如瘋長、瘋枝、瘋杈。如劉紹棠《小荷才露尖尖角》：「哪料到麥收過後，比往年雨水勤，瓜秧子瘋長，生瓜就放炮。」
